Reviews.Title: “TOP 10 HOTELS I HAVE STAYED AT”
Reviews.Author: mlc222
Reviews.Content: Great location. Rooms are beautiful. Perfect. Everything you can imagine. Amenities are great - cool restaurants, workout room great. Pool is sleek and nice. Location is perfect and accessible to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: JHLAtlanta
Reviews.Content: Legit 5 star hotel. Great rooms, great location, great service, real good food. Think this is my new favorite hotel in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Service, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: cmi113
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a short business trip and found the staff to be extremely friendly and willing to attend to your every need. It has a very modern vibe and the rooms are clean and well appointed with granite baths, one touch shades, and comfy beds. Was placed on a smoking floor and they moved me as soon as I asked for a change. I asked for a bottle of bubble bath and returned from dinner to find a full bath drawn for me--now that's service. Excellent location on Magnificent Mile and walking distance to everything. I would have given it 5 stars, but due to time constraints I did not experience Nomi restaurant, the spa or the fitness center. Would absolutely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “affordable elegance”
Reviews.Author: Greg S
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Park Hyatt in Chicago a few times and have always had an excellent time there. The rooms are contemporary and elegant. The service is always helpful and effective. I would like to live here! The hotel is located in a perfect place - access to Michigan Avennue, Rush Street and the loop. They have a great spa too!.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis in such a busy, noisy wonderful city.”
Reviews.Author: EuropeLaSalle_Canada
Reviews.Content: The second time we have stayed at this fine hotel, and it was just as good as the first. Super fast check in, friendly helpful staff. Rooms spotless,large super comfortable bed, good size bathroom with separate shower. Excellent room service. Nomi Restaurant is superb. Large inviting bar ad lounge ....Stay here, you will not be disappointed...plus its so convenient to get around.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location....”
Reviews.Author: bamboola
Reviews.Content: .... for shopping. Close to Water Tower Place and across the street from Nordstroms Rack. Parking is prohibitive at $55 a night, so we parked the car ourselves in the ramp one block away (probably where the hotel would have parked also) for only $35. Room was nice and we had a view of the Water Tower. Had to request turn down service and also had to ask for chocolates, which were not provided at turn down. Breakfast was very good, but pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect - the best hotel in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Andrew H
Reviews.Content: Beautiful rooms, perfect location, excellent service, large room, larger bathroom (w separate toilet and a large tub), everything looks brand new. Very comfortable bed and linens. I can't say enough - amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Great on so many levels”
Reviews.Author: RichardU71
Reviews.Content: What a nice hotel! This provided much more value than I expected it to do (and I didn't have low expectations). Was here for a conference and stayed for three nights and here is a summary of +/- Location : fabulous on Michigan Av and actually has lake view from some rooms (incl 803). Situated just opposite Ralph Lauren and the RL Grill (which was great as well). Hotel itself : good mix between modern and classic. Standards and cleanliness was very good. Good roomy lounge area downstairs. Conference facilities : very good and the catering was excellent as well. Rooms : much larger than expected. Huge bathroom with window across the bedroom for a lakeview (room 803) which was very impressive and nice. The room itself was also very large, great bed, excellent work desk and had all the facilities you might need (excl coffee maker). Very nicely decorated, high standards and very clean. Fitness room : pretty big, well equipped and connected with the SPA (incl changing rooms). All in all it felt modern and a good place for a nice workout. Bar / Restaurant : NoMi lounge, bar and restaurant on the 7th floor. Interesting menu with good tasting food. Pretty well stocked wine list and good selection of international and local beers. Service was great and always with a smile (not the least from Stefan). Service : Excellent, not one bad experience. Everyone very curteous, friendly and professional. A well run team I think. All in all, this is an excellent hotel that I would recommend to anyone, whether going there on business, for shopping or just a trip away with the family.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for downtown Chicago, will come back again”
Reviews.Author: Missymeatball
Reviews.Content: My husband & I went back to Chicago to visit the family for Christmas 2011. After one week, we decided to head into Chicago and spend our last 4 nights downtown. The hotel was very welcoming when we checked in and boy, did we have a lot of baggages to load up since we'd been shopping all day. The hotel room was very comfortable and warm, the bed as well was a god send since we had been sleeping pretty rough since we arrived. The staff were helping with their recommendations and everything was within walking distance or a short cab ride to where we wanted to go. I liked the location of the hotel right on the river and slightly off the city centre so it was more peaceful. Will definitely come back next time we stay downtown and will recommend to family members as well.

Reviews.Title: “great priceline value”
Reviews.Author: Aphishionado
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for $58 on priceline (in 2010 I got it for $50). local is superb, right off Michigan avenue walking distance from Navy Pier and Millenium Park. the room was clean spacious and had a very comfy bed, flat screen. pros: excellent fitness center, incredibly polite and attentive staff, stetson's bar has great bar snack mix, location cons of this hotel: internet is expensive, $52 for parking, if you dont want a busy hotel it is not a good fit. if you like a busy hotel, it's perfect.

Reviews.Title: “My New Favorite Place to Stay in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: TravelingBeautifully
Reviews.Content: If you are a frequent tripadvisor viewer like, me, you probably scroll through the pictures that other travelers have taken to get a sense of the property. By doing this and observing the photos that other people took of the stay, by the 10th picture of this property, I was sold. You can tell by the sleek, chic room dÃ©cor how awesome these rooms are. I was inspired and booked my stay here, coupled by the fact that this hotel had dropped significantly in price at the time of my booking, making it the overall winner. When we pulled up in our cab, even the outside of this hotel is amazing, stunning, and impressive. It is ideally located and truly in the middle of everything. We noticed right away that NoMI is the affiliated restaurant there, which was a good sign for us. Once out of the cab, the doorman is microphoned and asks for your name. He â€œmicsâ€� your name to the front desk so that they can pull up your reservation and that they are all ready for you. It is pretty awesome. The sweetest, most professional reception girl greeted us and processed our check in seamlessly. At our former hotel (the Conrad) we were stuck looking into another office building from our hotel room. Here, we were smart, and requested a view. She stated that it would be $30 more for a view, and we politely declined. This hotel is definitely a splurge purchase, and you really donâ€™t want to pay much more than what you already have paid. Interestingly enough, when we checked into our room, we had a stunning, gorgeous view of Chicago. (Thanks, check in girl!) In a previous review, I complained that the Conrad had no â€œWOWâ€� factor, but was simple and suitable. THIS hotel is one big wow factor after another. The lobby is gorgeous, dark, stately, and sexy. It is just a place where you want to stay at as long as possible. When you go into your room, you are just struck by the trendy, cool, vibe that rises up and greets you. The rooms are immaculate and pristinely designed to satisfy even the most highbrow consumer. The blinds are all electronically controlled by the wall, along with your lights and just about everything else in your room. The office desk is this really modern, cool design and swings on over across into the room. I was immediately in love. The main stunner? The bathroom wall opens, so you can take a big, bubble bath, while sitting in your tub, enjoying the view of your room, or outside your window. It is a REALLY well designed room, and smartly aware of what a traveler wants for a comfortable stay. HUGE bonus points awarded for the bedding. This is why you pay more for a hotel room. Probably one of the best nights sleep I have ever had the pleasure of enjoying. In fact, we loved the bedding so much, contacting the hotel about their complete list of bedding / mattress / mattress pad is still on my list of things to do. It is something that I would be interested in replicating for my own home. (Yep. It is THAT outstanding!!) Here is what makes this a 5 star property: Extras and details. I got to enjoy the most luxurious bath with complimentary bath salts, stocked in the rooms. It was truly a special experience and trust me, we really didnâ€™t want to leave. Additionally, the mini bar is well stocked with all sorts of treats, plus complimentary apples in your room for you to enjoy. We loved everything about the room. The one downside came into play when I ordered breakfast the next morning. I ordered a basic breakfast ($16 and not a bad price for this nice of a property) plus a side of fruit, a juice, and coffee. When I went to go pick it up, I had to wait about 15 minutes for the girl to get back with my change. I just was left there, standing, with no explanation. I paid in cash, instead of charging it to my room. Normally, this wouldnâ€™t annoy me, but it is early, I am tired, no makeup on as people are trickling in to enjoy their $60 brunch, and I just wanted to pay and get out of there. Instead, I had to loiter around this fancy hallway endlessly for her to get back with my change. Apparently, she explained that they only rely on the bartender for change and since the bartender wasnâ€™t there on Sundays, she had to go downstairs to the reception area to hunt down change. Fine. I would have appreciated being told that, and I would have just charged it to my room to save both of us the trouble. Now 20 minutes later, I high tailed it back to my room, with the breakfast in hand. I open it only to find BLACK toast, totally burned. Really? Who would be so careless to package up burned toast at this nice of a hotel at these prices. My bill was $34 for 1 meal, 2 drinks, and my toast was burned? Fine. I then realized that they didnâ€™t process the order right. It was supposed to include a meat (not included in my takeout) and the toast was supposed to be included (which I was charged for.) SUPER annoying. My coffee had no cream or sugar, which we had to go back downstairs to get. In an ultra-classy, uber trendy hotel, I just would have expected things like this to go much more smoothly. I will say, the staff is super nice, accommodating and polite. It is just the breakfast on Sundays that can use some work. Reluctant to leave, our checkout was smooth and uneventful. The bellmen are all very prompt and professional; they have been well trained and work very hard for the hotel. We were really impressed. With the exception to the breakfast blunder, this has become my favorite place to stay in Chicago. I would describe this hotel as dark, modern, sleek, sophisticated, sexy, trendy, professional, upscale, desirable, and luxurious. If you can afford the splurge of spending to stay here, do it. One of the best hotels I have ever stayed in and will look forward to a return here sometime.

Reviews.Title: “One of my favorite hotels in the world...PERIOD!”
Reviews.Author: JamesE339
Reviews.Content: I speak often of customer service. From Asia to Europe, to here at home....I often have the opportunity to talk about what it means to provide exceptional customer service. For many years, i have shared not one...but SEVERAL stories of where this property made an impression on me. This hotel is simply WONDERFUL! The location cant be beat. Its on the doorstep of Chicago's best.... The decor is terrific. I prefer a hotel that is not too 'fluffy', and this hotel features stunning artwork, classic furnishings...and a 'WOW' factor that makes me happy every time i walk in the doors. Nomi is a dining option that is rare in a 'Chain' hotel. Its a Chicago DESTINATION. From the view, to the incredible bar vibe...to the AWESOME food offerings, this is and continues to be a very popular Chicago TRADITION. Even if you arent staying here at the Park Hyatt, drinks at Nomi should be part of EVERY hotel stay. I have tried the Peninsula, The Four Seasons, The Ritz, and so many other Chicago hotels. I keep going back to Park Hyatt. The staff is what really sets this property apart. Wow...the stories i have to share. Wonderful, caring stories that will always make this hotel a favorite for me. Downside? None.

Reviews.Title: “Third time here and is consistently fantastic every time!”
Reviews.Author: RP8133
Reviews.Content: Just here for a quick overnight meeting. This hotel has quickly become my favorite in Chicago. the location is fantastic and the room and service are exemplary. From my check in yesterday, asking for a few special requests from the front desk were met with immediate service. I drove in, my back was killing me and I asked for a massage before my dinner meeting. I got right in and it was fanastic! I also asked for a special charcuterie and cheese platter that they didn't have on the menu and they made something wonderful and sent it up. LOVE LOVE LOVE this hotel and you will too.

Reviews.Title: “Chicago's Finest”
Reviews.Author: Rach1382
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at virtually every five star hotel in Chicago, and there is a reason why I routinely return to the Park Hyatt. First of all, location. Second of all, deep soaking tubs (especially in the winter). Third of all, NoMi. And, did I mention the service? All contribute to create an excellent stay every time I return. The rooms are impeccable, the service is five star and the location is smack dab in the middle of Michigan Avenue. Ask for a room Lake Michigan/Water Tower facing. Hands DOWN my favorite hotel in Chicago. I stay here at least twice a month for business and look forward to my stay every time. Let Ramon (the hotel's driver) take you around in his 7 series- he is fantastic and always very professional.

Reviews.Title: “Park Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: nancyn34
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Posh Park Hyatt hotel in downtown Chicago. They have exceptional First Class service from the moment we pulled up for valet service. This is also a good place to "spot" celebrities as well! We ran into Larry King and Martin Sheen in the lobby. The hotel itself was very beautiful and classy, everyone was very professional that you didn't even have to lift a finger for anything. We had a king size room with a beautiful view of downtown Michigan Ave! Very spacious room with desk/chair, huge flat screen TV, one side of our room was all windows with that gorgeous view of the courtyard off of Michigan Ave. The bathroom was spectacular, his and hers sinks, shower with double heads and a jacuzzi type tube that had double sliding doors that opened into the room to catch the view. My husband did check out the pool which was just a lap pool and they also had a hot tub too. This hotel was right in the heart of everything, great location to variety of restaurants and of course Miracle Mile for shopping! I would give this hotel 5 stars!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Hotel in Ideal Location”
Reviews.Author: celusnek
Reviews.Content: Our long weekend stay at the Park Hyatt was wonderful. Arrival and check-in is very personalized and informative. We felt like they were expecting us! The common areas are more like a home than a hotel lobby. The complimentary hot beverages in the library are a nice touch. Our corner room on the 16th floor is around the corner from the elevator yet quite. The king size bed made up with featherbed and luxurious linens is remarkably comfortable. The lighting is perfect with dimmers on many switches. Thereâ€™s a long window seat where you can spend the mornings watching the city come to life. The dresser and closets have ample storage. The bathrobes are fluffy and cozy. The bathroom is a delight with lots of super soft towels. The super nice shower has great water pressure. The soaking tub is fantastic. The amenities, especially the conditioner, are top notch. The hotel is located right in the middle of the high-end shopping area and right between the three most famous spots for Chicago deep dish pizza. Plus itâ€™s very convenient for transit users. We would love to return!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Luv2TravWayne_NJ
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Park Hyatt Chicago in January 2010 with friends for a long weekend. Hotel was in a perfect location to catch city tour, shop on Michigan Avenue and accessible to a variety of restaurants. At the time we were there the restaurant was being renovated so we ate breakfast in the lounge off the lobby. Not ideal but it worked. The complimentary car service was a nice perk for dinner reservations further out. Rooms were clean and comfortable. We were impressed with the size of the bathroom and design. Would certainly consider staying at the Park Hyatt Chicago again and would recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with the best staff in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Josh C
Reviews.Content: Where to start... Very clean, nice sized rooms and a great location. Excellent amenities. There was nothing wrong at all with either of my stays at this location. American Girl store a block away was a hit with my daughters - great time overall.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad thing to say. Overall great experience.”
Reviews.Author: Sienna01
Reviews.Content: This hotel had a great friendly staff, excellent location and large clean rooms. A coworker crashed my trip at the last minute and the front desk accommodated my request for separate beds (by giving us a corner room with two twins) although they had previously stated there were none available. I was extremely happy to have my own albeit, small bed. The location cannot be beat if you are looking at the sights.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis on Michigan Avenue”
Reviews.Author: PlayaChicago
Reviews.Content: My husband and I escaped to the Park Hyatt to get some shopping done. The hotel completely fulfilled our expectations. The hotel is immaculate and extremely well maintained. With consideration to our provided room and the overall check in/out process, I could not find one fault at all. We had a room on the 5th floor directly facing the Water Tower. It was incredible to sit on the window seat and watch everyone pass by; we loved this view and were perfectly happy not to be on a higher floor. The amenities of the room exceeded our expectations. From the comfortable bed, quality linens, huge flat screen TV, plush robes, bathtub for two (with candles and bath salts), iPod/Phone speakersâ€¦.I could keep going. At turndown service our ice bucket was filled so we didnâ€™t even need to call or find the ice machine for our bottle of champagne later that night. The only fault I have to mention is with the service at NoMI in the bar area. We stopped in for drinks and appetizers and were immediately provided a very nice table for two. After that we ordered relatively quickly; however, our appetizer actually arrived prior to our first round of cocktails and then when we were ready to go, it took at least 15 to 20 minutes just to get our check after asking. This service falls short of my expectations when paying $15 a drink at a renowned Chicago restaurant. Overall I would highly recommend this hotel and would book a room that faces Michigan Avenue directly.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious hotel just off Michigan Avenue”
Reviews.Author: kimjim
Reviews.Content: The rooms in this hotel are very large and luxurious. The entryway allows one to enter without people in the hallway seeing much of the room, so there is more privacy than most hotel rooms. The closet opens from two sides - one from the bedroom and one from the bathroom. The shower and tub are located behind a glass door in the bathroom, there is a double vanity sink, and the toilet is in its own separate room. Toothpaste and a toothbrush, as well as the typical amenities, are provided for free. My only negative comment about the room is that the two beds were small. There is a lap pool with several lanes and boards and fins. This is a great hotel for those looking for luxury and are willing to pay for it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience, Awesome Location”
Reviews.Author: Sungirlxxxx
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights. November 2011.Booked through Amex. FHR . Checkin smooth. Service of all personnel just phenomenal. Given Water tower Suite . Beautiful spacious suite awesome view of Water Tower. NOMI service, snacks and breakfast great. Lobby really nice.Location of hotel awesome. Perfect for shopping, restaurants nearby. Used car service one evening , very convenient. Giordanos a 2 minute walk away.Hancock building across the street. Garretts for popcorn about 4 blocks away. CAF boat tours a short cab ride away walkable in the summer, but was too cold last week to walk. Really a wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I could live at the Park Hyatt!”
Reviews.Author: JanetLD
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location. Large, beautiful rooms. Spacious, high end bathrooms. Understated elegance. Stylish, contemporary decor. Friendly, efficient service. Best 5 star hotel value in the city!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great service”
Reviews.Author: tmsreise
Reviews.Content: 3 night weekend stay a week ago for combination of business and pleasure. Room was a king park view and was as advertised in photos on this site. I was very happy with the style of the room, and spent a good amount of time in the eames chair and at the desk getting work done on day 1. All service was impeccable, prompt, and highly responsive, including 2 room service meals (great sushi platter from NOMI), serveral other special requests, and car service to dinner one night. The location is right in the middle of mag mile, easy walk to river, loop, shopping, lots of great restaurants, and red line L stop 2-3 blocks away if you don't feel like hiking down to loop or further north. Stopped into the NOMI lounge on way out to dinner on Sat night. It was definitely hopping and crowded. I can see why a table for 20 would have been tough (per review below), but we didn't encounter any attitude by anyone working at this hotel - all were very gracious and helpful. Also didn't see any indication of security issues at all, and felt completely safe walking in and around the hotel at all times. General vibe of this place was quiet, understated, with small boutique hotel feel. Seemed to be mainly business guests while I was there. I would definitely go back, but might try different place next time for some variety.

Reviews.Title: “Top Shelf Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SoftwareTraveler
Reviews.Content: The entire experience of this hotel is five star. Great staff, helpful concierge, wonderful rooms with great amenities. I brought my son on his first big trip to Chicago and everyone from the door man to the front desk treated him like royalty. This is a big deal to a seven year old. We stayed in a double room with a great view of Michigan Avenue. The rooms are very well decorated and very comfortable. Great bathroom with a huge tub and plenty of space in the vanity area. I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Nomi lounge and Park Hyatt are awful!”
Reviews.Author: pseudoboy
Reviews.Content: A group of 20 professionals goes to the Park Hyatt hotel lounge based off a recommendation, for an after show drink. We are told to split up at 2 different tables on the clear opposite ends of the lounge. Then I am told by an eastern european waiter "You didn't honestly think you could walk into this place on a Saturday night, with a group of 20, and get a table w/o a reservation, did you?" Now, let me get this straight.........you're whining that a group of 20 just came into your bar, in a desperate economy, when you are charging $6+ for beer, and $15+ for cocktails?????!!!!!! I have lived in Chicago my whole life, and you can guarantee I'll never step foot into this lazy excuse for a high-end lounge, in the heart of Chicago's Mag Mile, again. Oh, and when I left the lounge (w/o ordering anything) there was a huge fight of about 20 gang-bangers beating up a guy on the door step of the Park Hyatt while hotel staff just stood around watching, until the Chicago Police showed up. Nice and safe if you're a family staying there. I have stayed at MANY Chicago hotels, and have NEVER seen this ever! Stay away from this hotel, unless you'd like your evening ruined by excessively incompetent, and rude staff! If I could give it ZERO stars I would have.

Reviews.Title: “Simply fabulous.”
Reviews.Author: AlohaGuest808
Reviews.Content: This hotel is quite amazing. Great location; it's right next to the water tower with lots of shopping to be done within the vicinity. Many eateries and attractions are nearby making it very convenient for first time visitors. The rooms are beautiful and well-appointed with quality furniture and decor. Granite accents embellish the room with a modern touch. Bathroom is ginormous with deep soaking tub and shower. Even the toilet has a separate room! Staff at this hotel are very pleasant and friendly. Karen, the chef concierge, was extremely helpful and knowledgeable. She definitely made our stay very enjoyable. So stay here! It's a gorgeous property with great customer service!

Reviews.Title: “The best we have stayed at in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: smoothcj
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at the Park Hyatt Chicago for the first time. Our American Express card had a special for this property so we decided to try it out. We have stayed at many hotels across the country and all types. This was the best by far than many others. They put us on the 17th floor with a gorgeous view of Michigan Avenue and the Lake. The room was a nice size with a window seat, Large desk/table, a Herman miller recliner chair with ottoman , a 42" flat screen television and king size bed. The bed had a feather mattress on top of the mattress and the most soft pillows. I have never had a bed that felt like sleeping on clouds (and we have stayed in many 5 star hotels). I had the best sleep and woke without headaches. The cable/satellite tv service was a little weird at times, but not too bad. I can't forget the electric curtains and all the light and curtain switches by the bed. My husband couldn't get over that. Very nice. It was like they thought of everything The bathroom had a jacuzzi tub plus a separate shower and a separate makeup counter with stool. We had plenty of room when we both were getting ready to go out. The small tv in the bathroom was also a thrill for my husband. He could watch the game wherever he was in the room. My husband was offered free shoe shining which he was thrilled to take advantage of . We enjoyed breakfast daily (in NoMi) that came with our special and they were very accommodating. The pastries and breads were made in house so were very fresh, the eggs are organic and they offered fresh fruit every day. The coffee wasn't my favorite, a little bitter, but everybody likes different coffee. The prices for breakfast and drinks were all on the menu they gave us, so there was no surprises with the bill.Room Service brought our breakfast one morning and the gentleman who delivered it was very friendly and did NOT push a bill at us waiting for an extra tip as we have had at many hotels. We ate at NoMi one evening. It is in the higher price range of meals but is worth it once in awhile. They must have fixed the door situation listed on another review as we did not see anyone from the fitness center or able to view it from the restaurant. Most all the staff were wonderful ( you always get one pea in the pod that is not as good, which we had as our server at breakfast on the second morning, but that happens). They called us by name from the very beginning and were always willing to please. They would open doors, greet us when we left and welcomed us back when we returned. They accommodated us with an umbrella on a rainy day and held our bags while we waited for our ride and we sat in the library with fresh tea & lemonade (or coffee if in the morning). The hotel is in a great location. Perfect for shopping and was easy for our family to pick us up there. There has been so many businesses anymore that have forgotten what service to the customer is. This hotel has brought it back to the forefront. We will definitely returned to this hotel again. When you have had the best sleep ever when traveling,exceptional staff and a nice room, and in a great location, why would we stay anywhere else?

Reviews.Title: “Seamless”
Reviews.Author: Nurseatsea5
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed in a Park Suite for four nights. From check In to check out our every need was not only met but was anticipated. We were addressed by name each time we encountered any staff members throughout the hotel. Our room was always kept clean and was extremely comfortable. We used the laundry service for overnight dry cleaning and it was returned the next morning as expected. My daughter used the spa and was very impressed with their services and their products. I used the gym and pool. The equipment was all updated and functional. The locker room was extremely clean and well stocked where robes and slippers were provided. We lunched at NOMI on their outdoor terrace. The food and service were excellent. I would like to compliment the management on their staff and services. I anticipate ( and look forward to ) another visit to he Park Hyatt Chicago in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Sophisticated & Relaxed Chicago Hote Stay”
Reviews.Author: JBS0001
Reviews.Content: Attention to detail, with large window seat in room (Park View King- though they are in all the rooms), sublime bathtub, fantastic gym with good array of exercise machines ( though should be more than one bike), indoor swimming pool and large locker room, cozy lobby set up with complimentary amenities including morning coffee, tea and espresso machine, afternoon and evening iced tea and lemonade, and restaurant and bar with great atmosphere and food and superb service of entire staff. Could use more lighting in room, especially bathroom, but great escape to stay in this windy and bustling city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ian47
Reviews.Content: Enter the hotel and you quickly realise, my stay will be a good one. Reception, fast and efficient meaning we were in our room very quickly and after travelling for 12 hours this was welcome. The room, a Park View double, was large, comfortable and well appointed with a very comfortable bed. A large bathroom with one of the biggest baths I have ever seen and a separate double headed shower. I used NoM1 the restaurant/bar numerous times during my stay and found it an excellent place for drinks, snacks and dinner. Throughout my stay the hotel staff were friendly, efficient and always charming in their attention to guests. The hotel itself occupies a prime spot on North Michigan Avenue just beside the Water Tower so ideal for all Chicago has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location near the important stuff.”
Reviews.Author: Fun2Bwithpair
Reviews.Content: It's a Hyatt, so you expect it to be great. It is a bit overpriced, but, there is value. The concierge was good, and the location is unbeatable. They have a variety of complimentary beverages 24 hours a day. Found housekepping a bit unresponsive--had to ask for somethings 3 times to get it done. You can walk to the Hancock Tower and a plethora of excellent restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Clean, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: vbair
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Park Hyatt Chicago over labor day weekend. We reserved a larger room with a view of the Water Tower. I would definitely recommend this hotel for the location, friendly staff and the fact that it is not grossly overpriced. All magnificent mile shopping and restaurants are conveniently right outside the hotel. Our room was clean and comfortable. We especially liked the blackout shades and sheers were motorized with the switch next to the bed. My only complaint is with the space configuration our particular room- doors in the bathroom opening into tight spaces or other doors, or closet doors with mirrors not staying open. The L-shaped couch next to the bed being a bit to large for that space and extended a bit too close to the side of the bed. These are just things that could have easily been avoided because there is enough space in the room for better layout. But they would not deter me from staying at the hotel again. We had appetizers at NoMI on the 7th floor one afternoon which was very pleasant and we received good service. We asked the concierge for a mexican restaurant recommendation one night and from the few given we decided to try Mercadito in the river north neighborhood, which was very lively and had great food and service. Overall I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A favorite year after year!”
Reviews.Author: therealscoutfinch
Reviews.Content: My mother in law, sisters in law, and I take a shopping trip to Chicago every December. We've stayed at the Park Hyatt for the last five years, after trying the Drake and the Omni. Impeccable service, wonderfully appointed rooms, attentive staff. We let them know one year that we preferred certain rooms, and they remember that and book those rooms for us now without our asking. We have used their car service and concierge several times, and both have been helpful and friendly. I wouldn't stay anywhere else in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Always a pleasure”
Reviews.Author: rcl5
Reviews.Content: Park Hyatt in Chicago has been an exemplary expereince for myself and my family. We have 3 sons and the staff has always been exteremly kind, pateint and attentive. The feel of the hotel is very warm and appealing. Add that to the location and for us, always a special treat.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MBQ
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel in epicenter of Mag Mile across from Water Tower. Very large and comfortable room with contemporary design that's easy on the eye and the body. HUGE tub...big enough for two. Good room service (dinner) and also excellent breakfast in NoMi Restaurant (try the French toast). Reception efficient and kind. Only niggle was housekeeping. Everything was spotless, but we left room at 9:15 a.m. and came back at 3:30 and it wasn't made up yet. Compared to other 5 star hotels, thought this was well priced. Suggestion: Go to RL GRILL, the restaurant tin the Ralph Lauren store across the street. It's terrific! The perch was the best I've ever had! Great "clubby" atmosphere. Reserve ahead and dress nicely.

Reviews.Title: “Nicest in Chicago. Recomended for couples”
Reviews.Author: stallion114
Reviews.Content: This hotel is extremely nice and very romantic. I believe I was just in a standard room, but it was incredible. Extremely spacious, electronic shades, luxurious in every way possible. My favorite part of the room was the bathroom which had a huge tub inbetween the room and the bathroom itself. Linens were unbelievably comfortable and I dont think I have ever even noticed linens before in my life so they were definetely something special. I requested a Lake view but was told they didnt have any available. If you can get a lake view take it. The staff was courteous, but I was told that I would recieve a bottle of wine as an amenity which was never delivered. Looking back on it I am not sure if I was supposed to be offered the wine inthe first place, so I didnt downgrade them for this.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not great”
Reviews.Author: HuarenToronto
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights over a weekend. Overall, experience was satisfactory. The property is well maintained, though it is dated and tired. Specific observations: Staff: Good, friendly - but not well informed. Sometimes it felt like they were trying to move us along so they could serve the next guests. This was true for frontdesk, concierge, Nomi and spa. One bright light was Meaghan at concierge. If you approach her with a task, she will follow through. Room: Clean, well appointed and small. The room is tastefully furnished but a little tired. Still look a little fussy and busy with older pieces of furniture and finishings. The one bonus is the Eames chair in each room. This is a good thing - if only there was more space to enjoy it. Standard room is ideal for one, but tight for two. Bathroom is nice and large. Tub is enough for two large people to sit comfortably. The handheld shower is better than the wall mounted one. Housekeeping: inconsistent and challenging. It felt like the hotel was under-staffed with services slow and requiring reminding. Called for room to be made up and turned down each day and 3 out of 4 days and to call twice. As there is no housekeeping button on the phone, had to call the operator where some seem to know you while others don't and unsure if messages are relayed. However, one the rooms are cleaned or turned down, it is done very thoroughly. In short, good housekeeping, when they come. Nomi and bar: Bad service. For a five star hotel, it is always unfortunately to see a group of staff standing behind the counter and gabbing away. What's even more annoying is when the service is inattentive. Guess the staff discussions were more important! The deco of the restaurant and bar are good and luxe. Won't the money and time, if only the service could be improved upon. Pool: good, well maintained and easy to use. Now if only we could get them to lower the temperature of the area and water. Spa: Surly staff with what looked like painful smiles. Service was mediocre and not a memorable or pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “As to be expected”
Reviews.Author: liaobuqi
Reviews.Content: It's a nice hotel, but whether or not its worth it really depends on the price you pay. For upwards of $400, not really worth it (you should stay at the Eylsian instead). A nice and quick check in process. But slowed down by the fact that there are only two elevators for the hotel. Concierge service was sporadic. The woman who pressed my suit was prompt and fast, but I had to call three times to get someone to shine my shoes. I did not have a nice view, although I imagine half of the hotel does have them. So just depends on what you get at the time. Overall it is luxurious, but not amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury and location w/ all the little extras”
Reviews.Author: PlanninPaula
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay. Ideal location to shopping, restaurants and public transportation. (red line 1 block away) Beautiful lobby and friendly superior staff from the front desk to the maids. Hotel offers complimentary house car drop off within a few miles of hotel (upon availability ) rental bicycles, running maps. By far one of the best service have experienced at a hotel. Complimentary gourmet coffee, expresso, teas in lobby were a nice touch. Nightly turn down service, w/ little added extras like maid arranging sinkside items into organized formations, folded clothes that were on a chair, maid saw us coming in one night and offered us. ice and water. We had a beverage before turning in for the night on the rooftop patio bar, and the host brought me a shawl because got a little chilly. Very impressed and hope others notice as well.

Reviews.Title: “A grand house full of hospitality.”
Reviews.Author: CaptAmazing
Reviews.Content: From the beginning till the end a pleasure. We stayed in a park view suite. It was clean and complete in regard to amenities. From here we had access to most everything the 'Magnificent Mile' has to offer (including a built in Armani boutique). The fitness room and spa were great. What a pleasure!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with magnificent location and view!”
Reviews.Author: RP8133
Reviews.Content: Staying here for a meeting. I was amazed at how upscale this hotel is. Perfect location within walking distance to everything. Around the corner from Water Tower place and Rush street. Hd dinner on the outdoor patio at NoMi and loved the scene and food. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at the Park Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: TheFrasiers
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a memorable two-night stay for my birthday this August. We did not have any complaints and loved every moment. To begin with, the hotel is in a perfect location. The standard room is spacious and meticulously clean. Loved the openness of the bathtub. The staff was friendly and accommodating. The first night, we arranged to have the hotel BMW drive us to dinner (Japanois-- also excellent!). The fitness center has updated machines. They ran out of bottled water, so they sent up six bottles of water to our room after our work-out. The hotel also sent a bottle of champagne and chocolate covered strawberries for my birthday. On our last day, we used the complementary hotel bikes. We would love to return to the Park Hyatt!

Reviews.Title: “MAGNIFICENT HOTEL! We'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: mjk717
Reviews.Content: We brought our two Granddaughters (ages 3 & 5) for a 3-night stay, and it was just a perfect experience all the way around. From the valet parking, bellman, concierge, all staff - an absolutely terrific time! Superb accommodations were top notch. My Granddaughters just LOVED how they never had to open a door every time we left the hotel or came back (I was thankful they said "Thank you!" every time!). Our room had a balcony overlooking Water Tower - views were spectacular! If you bring young children, be sure to bring life vests for swimming - the pool is 3'8" throughout. Thankfully I had called ahead and we brought them. All the staff made a big fuss over the girls - and when housekeeping came (she was FANTASTIC!), she laid out the girls' nightgowns on the beds & put their stuffed animals very neatly propped up on the pillows! Too cute! STAY HERE! YOU WON'T BE SORRY!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant, great location”
Reviews.Author: BGosivetti
Reviews.Content: Nicely renovated rooms, attentive staff, and well-situated right by the Water Tower on the Magnificent Mile. Very reasonably priced for the quality and service.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay on the Mag Mile”
Reviews.Author: Triptek
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Park Hyatt in Chicago. The staff is very attentive, check in was fast and efficient. The rooms are spacious and have a wonderful Eames leather chair that the first one in the room always went for. The amenities included high quality bath products complimentary bottled water in the room. Coffee in the Library in the morning and fresh squeezed Lemonade in the afternoon. Complimentary hotel car (BMW) to take you within a 2 mile radius, fabulous workout center and changing room with Frette towels and Steam room and Shaving Oil, Shaving Cream and AfterShave. The restaurant (Nomi) was just redone and has fabulous food in a more casual elegant atmosphere than previously. Great outdoor bar on the 7th floor. Perfect location behind the water tower. Not a cheap stay, but if you enjou the finer things in life - this is a great spot.

Reviews.Title: “Not much to dislike”
Reviews.Author: bgagnon
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Park Hyatt Chicago at the tail end of our Route 66 trip. What to love? Location Service Rooms Concierge Spa Pool View What not to love? Maybe price? I mean if you are going to stay here you are getting the whole package and you have to expect this is not a road side motel price. You will be hard pressed to dislike anything at the Park Hyatt, it is as close to a home run that you can get.

Reviews.Title: “Great urban retreat on Michigan Ave”
Reviews.Author: Vincent_St-Maurice
Reviews.Content: Great room, large and comfortable, very well equipped (including magnificent bathroom) , great service with a friendly and welcoming staff. We had a very nice weekend in Chicago in this hotel which is ideally located to explore and discover the great windy city. Everything within walking distance. We haven't tried any of the restaurants, except the bar on the terrace which is really nice on a sunny afternoon.

Reviews.Title: “Where You Want to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: AnneInPeoria
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 3 day 2 night stay in Chicago and were guests at the Park Hyatt on North Michigan Avenue. My sister and husband have stayed here often and invited my husband and I as their guests. She would often rave about this hotel and I have to say, she was right! The moment you arrive, the hotel staff is assisting you with you luggage and getting you taken care of, all done with smiles and a great attitude. We checked into the room and were wowed by the beautiful view of Lake Michigan and the old Chicago Water Tower. The rooms were very comfy and roomy. We had an ajoined room so that my husband and I could help out with 2 small children. There was already ice in our room, and complimentary apples and water. After returning from lunch at the Cheesecake Factory, which was a short walk down the block, we decided to head to the pool. The pool is quite large and the temperature was perfect! The hot tub was a welcome relief after our drive. There is an small, outdoor area if you want to catch some "rays" and work on a tan. There are rooms available just outside the pool with blow dryers and dressing areas. My sister ordered room service, while my husband and I opted for a hot dog place right next door. I've had room service before and didn't think much of it however, even the kids chicken nuggets, which were actually strips, were great! Very tasty and very nicely presented. (The kids loved it!) The hotel was very quiet in the hallways and sleep was only interrupted by an occasional fire truck from the block up the street; but that was easily drowned out by a fan that was sent up to the room! Upon arising the next morning, we helped ourselves to the complimentary coffee in the lobby area, which was also great tasting coffee! The staff was extremely helpful and friendly during our stay. I don't think we came across anyone who wasn't smiling! The only down side for us is the price, or we would definitely be staying again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: FutureExpatriates
Reviews.Content: Starting with the doormen and front desk clerks to the concierge, housekeeping staff, and in-room dining attendant, all services were supreme. The room was incredibly comfortable. NoMi was still closed as was the pool, so I look forward to returning after the renovation. I would highly recommend this hotel for a MagMile visit

Reviews.Title: “Great location- nice conditioner:)”
Reviews.Author: Lee_Zure
Reviews.Content: Nice view of Water Tower. Very Friendly & Polite Staff. Breakfast at Nomi very nice. Great Outdoor rooftop bar for happy hour glass of wine and an app. Room was Spacious enough- but certainly not a wow. Great location. Clean and updated. House Car will take you around if it is available. Free bikes & Wireless. We both commented on fragrance of bath products and conditioner. Water at turndown- no treats.

Reviews.Title: “One of my new favourites”
Reviews.Author: vancity9
Reviews.Content: This hotel was beyond amazing. Right when you walk in you will encounter the friendliest hotel staff around. The service I received here from the staff was the best of any 5 star hotel I've stayed at. The rooms are beautiful: very large and comfortable. Ordered room service one day which was quite good. The location of this hotel is probably one of its biggest assets. Right on Michigan Avenue and close by to all of the top stores.

Reviews.Title: “Wow. I want to come back here!”
Reviews.Author: BixUS
Reviews.Content: Perfect location. Arrived at 1 am because of a flight delay and still got great service. Even had terrific steak dinner sent up at 1:30 am. Complimentary shoe shine. Small TV in bathroom while I shaved. Just the bathroom was nicer than most hotels I've been to. Terrific food and meeting facilities. Just wished I had been able to spend more time or get back to this place. One of my favorite hotels across the world.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but need to resolve labor problems”
Reviews.Author: motohigh
Reviews.Content: We had a great time and the staff was wonderful. However, we did have to cross a picket line one day. Is it possible that at $400+ per night they are really paying their maids $7 or $8 an hour? Take that out of the equation and this was a delightful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best”
Reviews.Author: woozal27
Reviews.Content: We have just had 4 days here and it was beautiful. We had beautiful views to the lake from our wonderful room on the 14 th floor. It was immaculatel, the service was faultless and the location is excellent. Such a shame it has no Club level though and no extra services are extended to gold/ platinum members but free wifi. Would definitely recommend though. Also there was no restaurant but it should be operational in the next few weeks.

Reviews.Title: “Nice ambiance on Michigan Ave”
Reviews.Author: CarstenW2
Reviews.Content: I am a big fan of the Park Hyatt brand and if there is a Park Hyatt where I travel I usually choose to stay there. Which is why it is so exciting to have one right here at home in Chicago! I have stayed here several times for my version of a staycation and love the property. As others have noted service is perhaps a notch below other Park Hyatts, but the location and food & beverage options (can't wait for NoMI Kitchen to open), are impressive. Diamond recognition is quite good, and this is certainly one location where one should opt for the welcome amenity over the points. The hotel recently introduced very nice new bath amenities (Le Labo 36) which are a definite improvement and almost as nice as the Le Labo 22 at the Park Hyatt DC. Rooms are somewhat smaller than at other Park Hyatts. Overall, a terrific property!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service, beautiful hotel, and great location”
Reviews.Author: Shidou
Reviews.Content: After 3 days of a nonstop convention, we needed a break from the sea of people and some luxury. We stayed here May 22, 2011. The location is hard to beat, it is on the corner of Michigan avenue and Chicago. We arrived at around 11;45 am, and our early check in was no problem. The front desk clerk was friendly and professional. I did not sense an attitude even though I look young and was on a Hyatt point stay. We were given a room overlooking the lake and old water tower. The view was so pretty, that I could have spent hours on the built in window seat. The room was very spacious and clean. The bathroom was amazing. It was about the size of 4 or 5 standard hotel bathrooms out together. The tub was large enough for 2 large people comfortably and there were candles and aromatherapy bath salt to help you relax. The glass enclosed shower seemed nice and had multiple show heads but I did not try it. My partner loved the TV and phone in the bathroom. The internet was free and I had no problems with the connection. Room service was delicious and the "park breakfast" was a good value for the money. I will be back and highly recommend treating yourself to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The only bright spot during a bad trip”
Reviews.Author: ATravelingGirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Park Hyatt for a meeting in Chicago. I was sick (sinus infection) and I lost my wallet with my ID, credit cards, ATM cards and cash. I was miserable. The Park Hyatt employees helped me get cash (so I didn't feel helpless) and I went home early. The day I flew home my wallet was recovered but the person didn't want to take the time to mail it. I told them to drop it off at the park hyatt. When the park hyatt received it they called me and mailed it to me express! Thank you! :-) My room was awesome! I looked down on the water tower. I would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “A business hotel, but not for kids or family vacation.”
Reviews.Author: KollegeKlubMadison
Reviews.Content: The hotel is exceptionally clean in all areas, and i compliment it on that. After wanting to try this property for a long while, i took my family over new years. It advertises as a 5 star property, but it is not up to the level of the Four Seasons, Ritz or Peninsula Chicago. It is essentially a 4 star Hyatt with a very nice location at the Chicago Water Tower and Michigan Ave, and an art-museum, fancy lobby. The pool area is probably one of the best in the Chicago loop area, and the food is very food in both the restaurant and room service. Outside of the these two, very expensive options for eating, you need to leave the property for family style dining. The reason i cant give this property 5 stars is because of staff service. Outside of the bellhops and valet, who were excellent, this is essentially the hotel of "no". I found that most times i asked a question or made a reasonable, simple request, the staff responded "no.". Or "no, the hotel doesn't allow that.". My wife and I sadly coined this property the "hotel of no" during our stay. For example, the hotel brags about its Butler service for every room. Well, when you ask the butler for a toothbrush or extra soap or towels, the butler says "no sir, you must call housekeeping for that.". The hotel brags about it's available car service. But when you ask to use it, the driver works less hours than an out of work school teacher. It was really quite absurd. Even try asking for a second wake up call or, better, for room service to deliver food to the pool area. Every time, consistently, we were met with "no" and then an explanation why they couldn't do it. Try bringing a glass of wine from the bar to the pool.... When my wife did, a very stern manager promptly entered the pool area and, basically, said, "no.". The rooms, while modern at some point in time, need a major rehab. We had a large suite, and the L shaped couch was torn and worn. The hyatt bed needed replacement as it was almost worn out. The bathroom and the locker rooms for the spa and pool were very nice and well stocked. Towel quality was reasonably good and soft. Overall, this is a solid 4 star business traveler hotel, less the staffing issues who probably could use some retraining. But not for a family vacation. Too bad because the pool and exercise room os very nice.

Reviews.Title: “not satisfied”
Reviews.Author: Minhtrung1811
Reviews.Content: First of all, I am a Hyatt Gold Passport Diamond member and PHC offered no recognition or amenities or breakfast and certainly no upgrades. That surprised me when I first checked in the hotel. Later I asked about it and found out that somehow the system messed up and showed me as a Gold member. I know it happened sometimes but it's still unacceptable. No apologies for the mistreatment either. At night when we got back to the hotel after a late dinner, hotel security asked if we were hotel guests and asked for our room key card. I think that's rude but hotel said that was normal. I have never seen that before really. Also there is a renovation going on so service is very limited. Room is nice and location is perfect but service is under par. I would rather stay at Hyatt Regency Chicago and get a better treatment.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel...lacks a Club!!”
Reviews.Author: jasonc001
Reviews.Content: Great location....very nice hotel...very nice rooms! Probably my favorite basic hotel room. The one thing that really bothered me about his hotel was it did not have a club level with amenity? Really poor for the hotel. Only have 1 rest. and it's really not that good. But I am going back in September and December again...and apparently they have made some changes.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but their Flagship ?”
Reviews.Author: DAWINTX
Reviews.Content: I had heard nothing but great things about the hotel prior to our one night stay. In fact, upon checking in, the very nice female checking us in informed us that the CPH is their Flagship property. I had requested a suite prior to check-in, but was told there was none available ? This despite the fact that the hotel seemed virtually empty while there, 03/26-03/27. Room was nice, great view. Bathroom amenities were average. You could hear voices from the adjoining room very clearly, # 1517 Bathroom towels were not what you would expect for a 5 star, looked and felt cheap, thin. As a Diamond member I have stayed at much nicer Hyatt properties, Grand Hyatt Berlin and Grand Hyatt Sao Paulo to name a few. Also, they misspelled my name twice, on the welcoming envelope, and in the welcoming letter. Would stay there again probably, but they need to take some lessons from some of their International properties. Not worth $400--$500/night...

Reviews.Title: “Always Great”
Reviews.Author: Sneeker635
Reviews.Content: Everything about this property is amazing. The staff is always more than attentive and the rooms are very nice. The staff always goes above and beyond, some examples of this are: the doormen greet you by name, front desk gets the elevator for you ahead of time so you don't have to wait, house car is always available no matter where you are going. I stay on business and it is great but it would also be a great place to bring the wife for a romantic weekend. The huge bathtubs and mood lighting would make for a great night. Overall this place is great and I would come back again, which I have.

Reviews.Title: “Very posh and luxurious! restfull stay!”
Reviews.Author: Hinsdalemama
Reviews.Content: We had a couple of great romantic weekends there, and really enjoyed the hotel! There is nothing you will not like: the rooms are fantatic and very large, it is close to everything with a fantastic restaurant with killer views. We are coming back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Superb!”
Reviews.Author: jac1228
Reviews.Content: A truly grand experience. Luxury at a wonderful price. Accommodations, dining and customer service outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “awesome!”
Reviews.Author: jessica5228
Reviews.Content: loved this hotel...first time in Chicago--went for business meeting and wasnt disappointed. Food was excellent, hotel rooms were posh and lux. Very happy with my stay and would stay again. Right on Michigan Avenue.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best luxury hotels in the world.”
Reviews.Author: Malstyles
Reviews.Content: One of the best Luxury Hotels in the world. Â  Stayed in a Executive suite for my wife's birthday. The service and staff was excellent, from the moment we stepped out of the limo the staff was at our beckoning.Â  It was almost scary how well the staffÂ catered toÂ your every need, my wife was very pleased with theÂ Hotel and its decor.Â  The location was the best, walking distance to the FamousÂ Water Tower,Â John Hancock building, and all of the high end shopping one can handle.Â  We have been to severalÂ Five starÂ hotels in the past around the world fromÂ the Caribbean to Europe and excluding the 90 degree weather we have to put this hotelÂ at the top of our list.Â  We would definitely look at staying at other Park Hyatt hotel locations, I also became a Gold member for future stays.Â  Their was only oneÂ problem, and this would not stop me from giving a great review nor would this stop me from staying at any one of their locations again.Â  The futuristicÂ entertainment system looked great but did not work, the battery on the universal touch screen remote did not workÂ also andÂ would not hold aÂ charge, also my newÂ I phone would not work with the aux jack provided.Â  All said I was little disappointed but overlooked.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic - wonderful!!!”
Reviews.Author: flyfish08
Reviews.Content: From the valet parking, bellman, concierge, front desk staff, and restaurant staff - an absolutely wonderful experience. The accomodations were superb with attention to detail top notch in everyway. The only thing that surprised us was that there were no coffee makers in the room - however, a wonderful coffee bar was available in the main lobby. We will defintely be staying there again when we visit Chicago in September for a wedding! Keep up the good work! and - the location is terrific for shopping at Water Tower!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with good location”
Reviews.Author: Hans50
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel in a great location with very, very attentive staff--I would recommend this to anyone visiting Chicago for a weekend of arts and culture and shopping. Our room had a spectacular view of the lake and the Water Tower. Bedding was very comfortable. The best part of the hotel was the staff: extremely attentive and responsive to our requests. NoMI, their restaurant is very good. Too bad it's closing for five months for renovation.

Reviews.Title: “The nicest hotel I've ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: frekwentflier
Reviews.Content: I used a couple of free nights I had from Hyatt and stayed here 1 weekend. I'm a Hyatt Diamond. My wife & I received royal treatment during our stay. The room is the nicest I've ever seen. The bathroom is amazing, the bed was so comfortable, it was just unreal! As a Diamond I got free breakfast for us both and it was very good! I think it would cost $15/person normally and it would be worth every penny. The location is amazing! Right downtown near the lake. Very easy to walk around and see the sites. I can't say I'd ever pay my own money to stay here, but I'd definitely come back again if I wasn't paying.

Reviews.Title: “Park Hyatt = luxury and extras”
Reviews.Author: Grek
Reviews.Content: This place is fantastic. I'll skip the things others have already mentioned (bathtub, linens, view) and focus on a few other things we loved: The art. The collection in this place is fantastic. There are pieces in the public spaces--the lobby, the restaurant, and a small gallery just off the restaurant. It's small but wonderfully curated. There are also fossil and gem specimens in the lobby that are finer than many I've seen in museums. The food. We enjoyed both room service and meals in the restaurant, and both were fantastic. Perfectly prepared food served expertly. Make a point to have breakfast there at least once--the quality of the foood, from the great coffee to the organic yogurts to the fresh croissants to the perfectly poached eggs--is the perfect way to start the day. The toiletries. They seem to be a private label made only for Park Hyatt Chicago (can't be bought elsewhere, I tried), and the quality and fragrance are wonderful. Our stay at the Park Hyatt Chicago was relaxing and very enjoyable. There's nothing I would change about this hotel--top shelf.

Reviews.Title: “This will not be a five star experience until the suites are renovated!”
Reviews.Author: FMUBSU
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Park Hyatt shortly after it opened in 2004. We found it to be exceptional in every area. We decided to go back and spend Thanksgiving weekend and were excited about our long awaited return. Much to our dismay, time has not been terribly kind to parts of the Park Hyatt Chicago! We got a good deal on a suite and decided to jump on it since we were traveling with a friend. We know now why we got a good deal. The room was relatively shabby. The carpet was badly stained, ripped and frayed. The wallpaper was peeling in places. The suite was large and well laid out, but it was very poorly lighted. Neither of the TVâ€™s worked very well. The ventilation system made strange noises. We were very disappointed and called the manager to complain. He was very nice and apologized profusely. He said the hotel was aware of the condition of the suites and a remodel was scheduled for January. The regular rooms have apparently been renovated. I understand this, but a suite in a five start hotel in the third biggest city in the nation should never be allowed to fall into this condition in the first place! To placate us, a complimentary bottle of wine and a platter of cheese and fruit were sent to our room. This was appreciated. Despite the condition of the suite, the hotel still has many excellent qualities. The NOMI restaurant is still fantastic. We had a wonderful breakfast and great service every morning. The gym and spa are still in excellent shape. When we had a problem, it was addressed in quick fashion. Turndown service was the only weak area. And of course, the location across from the Water Tower on Michigan is superb. Once the suites are upgraded, perhaps the Park Hyatt will once again become a premiere property. Until then, go one block north or south to get a true 5 star experience at the Four Seasons and Peninsula, respectively.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel in the Heart of the Mag Mile”
Reviews.Author: mangoriver
Reviews.Content: I used to live in Chicago for 10 years so staying at a hotel in my town is a little strange. With the exception of the Westin on Michigan, I don't know what the other hotels in Chicago are like and cannot make a fair comparison. With that said, the Park Hyatt itself was very nice, but I was a little disappointed in the rooms b/c growing up in Chicago, I always heard people talk about how fancy the rooms are. My husband and I got a king looking west with pretty decent city views. I'm not sure the room is worth the price, but if you want to be close to the shopping on Michigan and a cab's ride from State Street, this is an fine hotel. Nothing will blow you away, but then again, the hotel gives you nothing to complain about. The best part of the stay for me was the food. Our cheese and wine tray was superb, and the breakfast at NoMi was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Incredible staff”
Reviews.Author: tmitchgill
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is PERFECT for anyone that want's to get everywhere in the city. Perfect for shopping / sight seeing on state street, or on the mag mile. The staff are amazing ! While you are there, don't miss out on the breakfast buffet. It is absolutley wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Escape”
Reviews.Author: Samoyedogs
Reviews.Content: My husband was stationed in Wisconin for 6 weeks before heading out to Kuwait next week. We decided to meet in Chicago, being that we have never been there. I wanted the last 4 days with my husband to be wonderful. I will not see him for another year. The hotel was one of the best places we ever stayed at. My husband and I travel frequently and I am total blown away with this hotel. We are not rich by any means but we were treated just as well as people who you knew had money. The doormen were respectful and opened doors, the staff was courteous and helped us plan trips. The rooms are unbelievable. Views were great. Best hot chocolate I ever had. I was total amazed how the elevators open up for us without us pressing a button. This place is great.

Reviews.Title: “Wish we could stay longer”
Reviews.Author: luv09life
Reviews.Content: I had plans to surprise the hubby to go see his favorite band in downtown Chicago and decided a hotel stay was a must too (we live 40mins outside Chicago). I LOVED this hotel! I loved the style, the service and the views of this hotel. I highly recommend it, we would stay again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “good”
Reviews.Author: haydee3
Reviews.Content: this hotel is good and has a good location, we had good time and the breakfast is really good and complete, the place look very clean

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly”
Reviews.Author: guavamoon
Reviews.Content: We've been staying at this gem of a hotel for the past 10 years and just keep on coming back for more....The Park Hyatt Chicago is a classic, like a Cartier watch or a Mercedes, understated, yet elegant, timeless, yet powerful, small, yet stunning in all details. Rooms with Water Tower views are a must and we never get tired of sitting by the windows and gazing outâ€¦to the tower, the lake, the bustling intersection below, the signs & lights of the surrounding buildings. It's meditative and addictve all at once. And then...THE BATHTUBSâ€¦.I think we would choose this hotel just for their luxurious bathtubs! Add the phenomenal food from Nomi's with their world class wine & champagne selection (Nomi delivers to your room, even if itâ€™s just one glass of Champagne!), the amazingly comfortable beds & linens that would flatter any emperor, the enticing bath products from Master parfumeur Blaise Mautin....and you got heaven on earth. Canâ€™t wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal hotel and location, questionable service.”
Reviews.Author: thekeone
Reviews.Content: The Park Hyatt could not be located any better. It is in the perfect spot for sightseeing, nightlife, etc. The pool and restaurants are amazing. The rooftop bar should not be missed, assuming the weather is cooperative. The rooms are beautiful and spacious, with a gorgeous bathroom setup. Unfortunately, not all is well with this hotel. I would guess that this hotel does not receive many 20-something customers. For the caliber of the hotel and the value of the Park Hyatt name, I thought the service was seriously sub par. It might have been because I was younger, but I was continually looked down upon when I was entering the hotel. The 50 year old couples were catered too exclusively, while I was left to open doors for myself. My expectations depend on the price and caliber of the hotel. If this had been the Sheraton Chicago Towers, the service would have been on point. But, Chicago has numerous 5 star options. The Peninsula, Ritz Carlton/Four Seasons, Trump, and even Omni are all comparable properties and consistently show strong customer service skills. I recommend this hotel for those that fit into their target demographic. For those of us that work hard and like to splurge during our youth, there might be better options.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch Luxury”
Reviews.Author: AveryWatkins
Reviews.Content: Stayed the night for our wedding anniversary getaway. The service was perfect, the rooms are modern yet luxurious, and the restaurant NoMI was an experience of art.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely beautiful - peaceful and well done!!!”
Reviews.Author: willieProvidence_ri
Reviews.Content: we loved this hotel - It is beautifully maintained and the rooms are elegant with no detail left out. The only issues we had were that we had to keep going down to the front desk to get new room keys because they weren't working. The lock in the door was broken but they kept telling us it was our fault because we were demagnetizing the keys - This happened 4x before they sent someone to fix the door lock. Also, we were awakened each night by loud people shouting outside our door but that has nothing to do with hotel management. I would still fefinitly stay there again - It is an amazing hotel, great location, great pool and great restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Great....BUT”
Reviews.Author: debkit
Reviews.Content: Let me first say that I absolutely love the HYATT properties whether it is Hyatt Place, Grand, Regency or Park Hyatt's. However, having stayed at the Park Hyatt in Tokyo and in Shanghai I felt the Park Hyatt in Chicago was lacking something. Considering what one is paying for the room, I think tea and coffee with some cookies should be standard. EVERY Hyatt or for that matter any Hotel I have been in has complimentary tea and coffee in the room. Overseas visitors especially from Europe are used to having tea and coffee in the room. The staff are incredible. Service excellent. Although, I must point out my omelette came with egg shells...I did not create a fuss because we were someone's guests for breakfast. Parking costs are EXTREMELY high $49.00 per 24hour period. I think there should be a discount for hotel guests.

Reviews.Title: “It speaks for itself”
Reviews.Author: rawdogg
Reviews.Content: High priced but a very nice hotel. Location is great for downtown. Rooms were large along with the bathroom. Loved the oversized tub. We were able to check in very early when we arrived at 10 00 am to our surprise. They also allowed us a late checkout. Bed was great to sleep. Loved the auto shade. Kept the room dark Great place for a getaway

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious!”
Reviews.Author: E_Dallas_10
Reviews.Content: The Park Hyatt is high priced, but the experience is luxurious. Perfect lighting, beautiful bathrooms, automated shades, great views. The gym is very nice, and the outdoor restuarant is wonderful for cocktails.

Reviews.Title: “Just the Perfect Hotel for Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: 007CubsFan
Reviews.Content: I am currently in the middle of my second stay here at the Park Hyatt Chicago and this experience is better than the first. I used my upgrade certificate and my only gripe ( a small one at that) was that I neither received a high room or a room with a view. However, the suite (Park Suite) is amazing! Very spacious at over 800 square feet. 2 bath rooms, 1 of which has separate bath/shower (shower is big enough for 3 and bath is big enough for 2). The master bath also has 2 sinks and is very spacious. There is a second restroom off the dining area. There is a huge TV (over 40+ inches), sound system w/ ipod input and DVD player. Everything is smart, clean, tasteful and comfortable. I took advantage of the free bikes. I enjoyed the bath (they have bath crystals to use as well). The soaps and amenities were fragrant and refreshing. The staff all provide the best service, with friendly faces and attitudes and very attentive. The breakfast is good but very overpriced if you actually have to pay for it. The portions are a bit small as well. The gym is nice and open 24/hrs. WiFI is free for all. The pool and jacuzzi are refreshing even after a hot humid day. The property is within walking distance of the metro (2 blocks), great shopping (around the corner), probably over 100 great places to eat from casual to fine dining. With the bikes you can easily see everything this great city has to offer. If you have a chance - check it out!

Reviews.Title: “Park Hyatt Chicago”
Reviews.Author: tommynine9
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel, and possibly the best in Chicago. Cleanliness - 5 - Nothing wrong with cleanliness in the hotel. Location - 5 - The BEST! Right on North Michigan Avenue, by the Historic Water Tower. Rooms - 5 - WOW! The rooms were very large, and quite nice. We had room 1205, the view was so great! Pay for the view! We had one king bed, and a rollaway. Both of which were VERY comfortable. The room had a window seat, a comfortable Eames Mies Van Der Rohe reproduction chair, a glass desk with chair, a HUGE TV (with HD!!!) a dresser and the closet. The mini-bar was fairly well priced, and there's free water and apples. The closet was cool, also opened to the bathroom and had a safe and a robe (wish it was two) and two pairs of slippers. It also had a variety of hangers and a shoe buffer. The bathroom was amazing! Great toiletries, two sinks, a HUGE soaking tub (candles and bath salts included) separate shower, TV, and little room with the toilet. This was definitely the best room I have every stayed in. Service - 4.5 - The only reason I gave a 4.5 was because unfortunately, the turndown service was inconsistent. At check-in we were upgraded, because of Hyatt Diamond Status. We also got choice of amenity, which was almost anything. They even gave my teenage son milk and cookies, which he liked, because he can't exactly have wine. The doormen and bellmen were nice. Our bags were held there and it was very prompt. Also, something cool, when you walk in, they hit the elevator button from the desk so you don't have to wait. Value - 5 - We only paid $16 a night because we had Hyatt BWB award nights, and the $16 was our breakfast tip. I can't really comment on value if we had paid full price. Sleep Quality - 5 - The curtains were good and there was not much noise. The room was cool and beds comfortable. This was a great hotel, we all loved it, and hope we can stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Even my teen age son was was impressed -- great job selecting the hotel dad.”
Reviews.Author: sailandtravelDc
Reviews.Content: I had a free night at any Hyatt from a promotion during the spring, so I used it for a one-night stay on a college visit to Chicago with my teenage son. We were able to confirm only a two twin bed room, but were advised to request two doubles at check-in. We arrived early around 9am, expecting to check our luggage. Despite being sold out on doubles, they checked for two rooms, both with doubles, and said we could check in soon. After about 15 minutes wait we decided to get breakfast nearby; when we returned we were told that we had an upgraded room ready. We went to the room, which overlooked the water tower on the 14th floor and had a great view of Lake Michigan down the street. Two double beds, a huge bathroom with two sinks, a separate toilet room, an oversized bathtub with a hand-held shower head, and a separate shower room with a rain-type wall mounted shower about 8' up and a separate hand-held. The door to the connecting corner room was open and it had a king bed. I couldn't believe that we had been given a two-room suite, so I called the front desk to check. I was put on hold but got no response so I called back after a few minutes. They first misinterpreted my question as a request for a second room, but when I explained that I was just checking to see if the doors had been left open by mistake they confirmed that I had reserved only one room. I locked the connecting doors myself. The room had bedside controls for the sheer and the blackout shades on the window and also for the lighting. Flat screen TV, i-pod dock, one robe (but two pairs of slippers) in the closet, two toothbrushes and toothpaste, iron, ironing board, shoeshine machine, hairdryer, safe, etc. Minibar, jars of nuts (3 kinds), bottles of imported sparking water, basket of apples. I assume that only the apples were complimentary though. (the sparking water bottles were moved to our nightstands with the turn-down service -- I guess they really wanted us to buy them.) Extremely comfortable beds with four pillows each, a modern leather lounge chair with ottoman, glass desk with chair, and a cushioned window seat were more than adequate. Complimentary internet access -- wired and wireless, although the latter worked for my son, it didn't for me, There was an ethernet cable in a fabric pouch marked "internet cable" in one of the drawers. We checked out around 7am and left our luggage in the hotel. I asked if we could use the pool and locker room in the afternoon and they said sure, no problem. We didn't need to keep our keys because there was open access. We returned around 4:30 pm and went to the pool. Locker room had full-sized lockers stocked with robes and slippers; towels were piles on a rack. Keys were in the unused lockers.
